idea-plugin.name: Manage Scheduled Events
idea-plugin.description:
An IntelliJ Platform plugin that discovers and lists methods annotated with @Scheduled in Java/Spring projects.

It provides a "Scheduled Events" tool window to browse events, view cron expressions, and navigate to source, with:

  • Search
  • Grouping by package or by class
  • Direct Cron validation and update
  • Optional ShedLock helpers: add/remove @SchedulerLock to all listed methods when ShedLock is present

ShedLock ensures that scheduled tasks run on a single node in clustered environments. When enabled, this plugin can add @SchedulerLock(name = "ClassName_methodNameLock") right after @Scheduled, and will manage imports for net.javacrumbs.shedlock.spring.annotation.SchedulerLock. You can later tweak parameters like lockAtLeastFor / lockAtMostFor as needed. Learn more at ShedLock.
